abstract: The Upshot; debate continues over which currency to use when measuring global economy; International Monetary Fund's formula, which adjusts for relative value of currency, finds global growth of 3.1 percent in 2015; worldwide growth declined by 5 percent when measured in dollars, whereas it grew by 13.6 percent when measured in euros; differences reflect fluctuating currency values year over year.
lead_paragraph: It all depends on what currency you use to keep track.

headline.main: The World’s Economy Soared Last Year (or Plunged)
headline.print_headline: The World’s Economy Soared Last Year (or Plunged)

snippet: It all depends on what currency you use to keep track.
